New Records: Kyle Tucker surpassed 100 RBIs, moving into the American League lead
Key Match Events: Yordan Alvarez homered in the third inning
Kyle Tucker added two RBIs, including a two-run double in the fifth inning
Jurickson Profar had a two-run homer for the Padres
Luis Campusano added two hits and an RBI for the Padres
Phil Maton pitched a perfect fifth inning for the win
Seth Lugo gave up seven hits and six runs in 4 1/3 innings
Pre-Game Insights: The Astros talked about the need to improve their record at home as the regular season winds down
Alvarez, who missed six weeks with an oblique injury, emphasized the team's resilience
Post-Match Reflections: Dusty Baker praised the team's performance, saying 'You don't hardly see a bunch of consecutive hits like that anymore'
Jurickson Profar said 'It's the job of the bullpen to come in and support the team'
HÃ©ctor Neris said 'It's my job to keep the game like that and... help us win'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros bounced back after losing the series opener 11-2 to get their fourth win in five games and increase their lead in the AL West to 1 1/2 games over Seattle
The game was played at Minute Maid Park in Houston
Kyle Tucker moved past injured Texas star Adolis Garcia (100) for the AL lead in RBIs
Others: Phil Maton got the win, and Seth Lugo took the loss
The Astros are 36-35 at Minute Maid Park this season
